DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study is to examine the suitability to detect diabetic neuropathy using NIR and impedance.
DOC.brief_title: NIR- and Multifrequent Impedance Spectroscopy on the Skin in Type 1 Diabetes
DOC.detailed_description: The aim of the study is to examine how suitable a hand-held measuring probe (DDD-probe) using NIR (near infrared light) as well as impedance (conductivity), is to detect early signs of diabetic neuropathy. The DDD-probe is put directly on the skin and is measuring by the use of light and impedance.
DOC.criteria: men with type 1 diabetes (WHO criteria) age 3550 years duration of diabetes > 10 years Pcreatinine> 120 micromol/l other acute or chronic disease, or type of treatment that makes the patient unsuitable to participate, valuated by the investigator non intact skin on the measuring spots the patient is unable to understand the informed consent
